p: The changes in E. coli and S. aureus populations of buffalo meat, including control and samples coated by PMSM and CLEO‐loaded PMSM, stored at 4°C for up to 10 days are indicated in Figure 4c,d. The initial E. coli and S. aureus counts in all samples were in the range of 0.09–0.30 and 0.13–0.24 log CFU/g, respectively. All the coated samples remarkably decreased the population of E. coli and S. aureus as compared with the control at the end of storage time; the maximum count of E. coli (2.00 log CFU/g) and S. aureus (2.67 log CFU/) were found in the noncoated buffalo meat, and the sample wrapped with PMSM + 2% CLEO showed the lowest E. coli (1 log CFU/g) and S. aureus (1.17 log CFU/g) populations ( p < .05).
